text: John E. Kenna is a 1901 marble sculpture of the American politician of the same name by Alexander Doyle, installed in the United States Capitol, in Washington, D.C., as part of the National Statuary Hall Collection. It is one of two statues donated by the state of West Virginia.Architect of the Capitol Under the Direction of the Joint Committee on the Library, Compilation of Works of Art and Other Objects in the United States Capitol, United States Government Printing Office, Washington 1965 p. 211 ==See also== * 1901 in art ==References== ==External links== * Category:1901 establishments in Washington, D.C. Kenna, John Category:Sculptures of men in Washington, D.C.
title: John E. Kenna (Doyle)
